article_title: Fewer PPOs On Obamacare Exchanges Mean Less Doctor Choice In 2016

article_metadata.description: When consumers enroll for 2016 health coverage via exchanges under the Affordable Care Act, they are less likely to find a preferred provider organization (PPO) plan, which could limit their doctor and hospital choices. PPOs tend to be more expensive to offer consumers because they allow subscribers to go outside of [...]
article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen
